app.header.account.help.title: Account explained
app.header.account.help.description: This is your XRP wallet address, commonly known as an rAddress.
app.header.entries.help.title: Entries explained
app.header.entries.help.description:
This is the total number of entries for your account on the XRP ledger.

If there are 2 numbers, eg: 2/7 the first the number of transactions being returned by the filters you have set and the second is the total number of entries for your account on the XRP ledger.
app.header.lastscan.help.title: Last scan explained
app.header.lastscan.help.description:
Once we have retrieved all your transactions we store them on this device for 7 days, to prevent excessive querying of the ledger.

You can refresh manually by clicking the 'refresh ledger' button within settings.
app.transaction.title: Transactions
app.filters.title: Filters
app.filters.help.startdate.title: Start date explained
app.filters.help.startdate.description:
Use the date and time picker provided.

Once set, only transactions after or equal to this date/time will show.

Dates are shown in the universal format used by the XRPL.
app.filters.help.enddate.title: End date explained
app.filters.help.enddate.description:
Use the date and time picker provided.

Once set, only transactions before or equal to this date/time will show.

Dates are shown in the universal format used by the XRPL.
app.filters.help.currency.title: Currency explained
app.filters.help.currency.description: Once set, only transactions in the currency selected will show.
app.filters.help.direction.title: Direction explained
app.filters.help.direction.description:
Direction usually applies to payments and this filter allows you to show only received or sent transactions.

The option 'other' applies to more exotic transaction types like 'Escrow'.
app.filters.help.type.title: Transaction types explained
app.filters.help.type.description:
The XRP ledger supports many different types of transaction, although payments are the most common.

If you set up a trust line at some point, the fee for that transaction will show as 'TrustSet'.

Selecting a type you have never used will result in zero results.
app.filters.datetime.title: Date and time
app.setting.title: Settings
app.settings.label.showfee: Show XRP fee on tokens as separate transactions
app.settings.help.showfee.title: Show XRP fees explained
app.settings.help.showfee.description:
A transaction for an XRPL token usually has a fee associated with it, denominated in XRP.

By default the fees for each transaction are shown with the transaction, but with this toggle you can split the fee and show it as a separate transaction on the ledger.

When doing this the ledger ID is shown instead of the fee, so that you can easily match the payment with the fee.
app.settings.help.language.title: Language explained
app.settings.help.language.description:
By default we determine the initial language of this app, from your XUMM app settings.

We do not however support the same number of languages as XUMM and the default is English, therefore you can select from any of the languages we do support on the basis that it may be preferable.
app.settings.label.ledger-cache: Days before ledger history is auto refreshed
app.settings.help.ledger-cache.title: Ledger cache explained
app.settings.help.ledger-cache.descripti:
Ledger transactions are downloaded once upon initial load and then stored locally on this device. This provides for a fast user experience whilst using this tool and also prevents unnecessary workload on the XRP ledger.

By default your ledger history will be automatically refreshed on load if it is older than 7 days, but you can change that frequency here.
app.settings.help.refresh.title: Refresh button explained
app.settings.help.refresh.description:
Ledger transactions are cached to prevent unnecessary workload on the XRP ledger.

If you have recent activity that is not showing you likely have an out of date transactions cache and you can use the button below to fetch a fresh copy.
app.settings.help.pinaccount.title: Pin header explained
app.settings.help.pinaccount.description:
The transactions page displays a header which contains valuable information such as your account address.

By default it is pinned to the top of the page, however this uses up valuable screen space. You can toggle this setting here.
app.export.title: Export
app.export.copied.title: Copied to clipboard
app.export.help.header.title: Include header explained
app.export.help.header.description: Enabling this option will add the row headers to the CSV export data.
app.export.help.delimiter.title: Delimiter explained
app.export.help.delimiter.description: CSV format uses a comma by default, but you can choose a different delimiter if you wish.
app.export.help.format.title: Output format explained
app.export.help.format.description: Transactions can be exported in different formats, please choose.
app.export.help.fields.title: Fields explained
app.export.help.fields.description: Control what fields from an XRPL transaction are included in the export.
app.export.fields.title: Output fields
app.ott.title: Account
app.ott.help.raddress.title: Account explained
app.ott.help.raddress.description: Account is the public address you give to someone in order to receive a transaction, sometimes referred to as an rAddress.
